title: Brazilian judge orders suspension of X in dispute with Elon Musk
content: X owner Elon Musk has refused to reestablish an office in the country to respond to government requests to take down accounts that spread fake news.
summary: X owner Elon Musk has refused to reestablish an office in the country to respond to government requests to take down accounts that spread fake news.

title: Israel strikes aid convoy organized by U.S. nonprofit, killing 4 Palestinians
content: The Anera convoy was carrying medical supplies and fuel to a hospital in Rafah, and its route was coordinated in advance with the IDF.
summary: The Anera convoy was carrying medical supplies and fuel to a hospital in Rafah, and its route was coordinated in advance with the IDF.

title: In a grim Russian cell, a hippie LGBTQ artist survived with her inner joy
content: Alexandra Skochilenko became known for flashing a smile and heart symbols in court even as she was sentenced to seven years in prison for a minor antiwar protest.
summary: Alexandra Skochilenko became known for flashing a smile and heart symbols in court even as she was sentenced to seven years in prison for a minor antiwar protest.

title: Ukraine Air Force commander dismissed after F-16 crash
content: Mykola Oleshchuk, the head of Ukraine’s Air Force, was replaced a day after the military said one of its Western-supplied F-16 fighter jets crashed this week.
summary: Mykola Oleshchuk, the head of Ukraine’s Air Force, was replaced a day after the military said one of its Western-supplied F-16 fighter jets crashed this week.

title: Israeli evacuation orders force displaced Gazans into ever-smaller spaces
content: Israeli evacuation orders in August have shrunk Gaza’s only humanitarian zone by nearly a third and deepened the plight of displaced Palestinians.
summary: Israeli evacuation orders in August have shrunk Gaza’s only humanitarian zone by nearly a third and deepened the plight of displaced Palestinians.

title: As Germany’s far right reaches milestone moment, extremists grow bolder
content: The AfD could emerge for the first time as the strongest party in a German state parliament after Sunday elections in Saxony and Thuringia.
summary: The AfD could emerge for the first time as the strongest party in a German state parliament after Sunday elections in Saxony and Thuringia.

title: What Ukraine’s Kursk incursion means for the war with Russia
content: Ukraine is hoping for an escape to victory.
summary: Ukraine is hoping for an escape to victory.

title: Ukrainian F-16 crashes, killing pilot, during Russian missile attack
content: The demise of one of Ukraine’s star pilots as well as one of its prized few F-16 jets is a massive blow for Kyiv as it seeks to gain momentum against Russia.
summary: The demise of one of Ukraine’s star pilots as well as one of its prized few F-16 jets is a massive blow for Kyiv as it seeks to gain momentum against Russia.

title: WHO says Gaza polio vaccine campaign to begin Sunday
content: Israel, health officials said, has agreed to “humanitarian pauses” to allow more than 600,000 children to be vaccinated amid an outbreak of the disease.
summary: Israel, health officials said, has agreed to “humanitarian pauses” to allow more than 600,000 children to be vaccinated amid an outbreak of the disease.

title: Israel kills Palestinian commander, traps civilians in West Bank incursion
content: The ongoing Israeli military operation killed at least 16 people, according to Israeli and Palestinian authorities, including a prominent commander.
summary: The ongoing Israeli military operation killed at least 16 people, according to Israeli and Palestinian authorities, including a prominent commander.

title: Biden administration restarts migrant program, boosting fraud checks
content: Illegal crossings along the southern border by migrants from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela have declined sharply since the parole program was launched.
summary: Illegal crossings along the southern border by migrants from Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela have declined sharply since the parole program was launched.

title: Russia-Ukraine energy war roars back into action after mediation fails
content: Russian refineries burn as Ukraine’s cities go dark ahead of a cold winter and renewed targeting of the energy sectors.
summary: Russian refineries burn as Ukraine’s cities go dark ahead of a cold winter and renewed targeting of the energy sectors.

title: Namibia to cull elephants, zebras for their meat during major drought
content: The southern African country plans to distribute the meat of hundreds of animals, including hippos and antelopes, to support relief efforts.
summary: The southern African country plans to distribute the meat of hundreds of animals, including hippos and antelopes, to support relief efforts.

title: An FBI quest to return sacred human skulls stolen from a Pacific tribe
content: The repatriation comes amid a visit by Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell, who said U.S. law enforcement assistance to the Pacific was set to grow.
summary: The repatriation comes amid a visit by Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell, who said U.S. law enforcement assistance to the Pacific was set to grow.

title: Israel launches major operation in West Bank; Palestinian officials say 11 killed
content: Israel’s military and internal security service said the operation was aimed at infrastructure used by militants in the cities of Jenin and Tulkarm.
summary: Israel’s military and internal security service said the operation was aimed at infrastructure used by militants in the cities of Jenin and Tulkarm.

title: Israel agrees to brief pause in Gaza for polio vaccinations, U.S. official says
content: Word of the planned campaign came as the World Food Program said it suspended movement of its staff in Gaza after a clearly marked WFP vehicle came under fire.
summary: Word of the planned campaign came as the World Food Program said it suspended movement of its staff in Gaza after a clearly marked WFP vehicle came under fire.
